1 /**
  2  * Emily
  3  * Copyright(c) 2012 Olivier Scherrer <pode.fr@gmail.com>
  4  * MIT Licensed
  5  */
  6 
  7 define("Promise",
  8 
  9 ["Observable", "StateMachine"],
 10 
 11 /**
 12  * @class
 13  * Create a Promise
 14  */
 15 function Promise(Observable, StateMachine) {
 16 	
 17 	return function PromiseConstructor() {
 18 		/**
 19 		 * The value once resolved
 20 		 * @private
 21 		 */
 22 		var _resolved,
 23 		
 24 		/**
 25 		 * The value once rejected
 26 		 * @private
 27 		 */
 28 		_rejected,
 29 		
 30 		/**
 31 		 * The stateMachine
 32 		 * @private
 33 		 */
 34 		_stateMachine = new StateMachine("Unresolved", {
 35 			"Unresolved": [["resolve", function (val) {
 36 								_resolved = val;
 37 								_observable.notify("success", val);
 38 							}, "Resolved"],
 39 							
 40 							["reject", function (err) {
 41 								_rejected = err;
 42 								_observable.notify("fail", err);
 43 							}, "Rejected"],
 44 							
 45 							["addSuccess", function (func, scope) {
 46 								_observable.watch("success", func, scope);
 47 							}],
 48 							
 49 							["addFail", function (func, scope) {
 50 								_observable.watch("fail", func, scope);
 51 							}]],
 52 							
 53 			"Resolved": [["addSuccess", function (func, scope) {
 54 								func.call(scope, _resolved);
 55 							}]],
 56 							
 57 			"Rejected": [["addFail", function (func, scope) {
 58 								func.call(scope, _rejected);
 59 							}]]
 60 		}),
 61 		
 62 		/**
 63 		 * The observable
 64 		 * @private
 65 		 */
 66 		_observable = new Observable();
 67 		
 68 		/**
 69 		 * Resolve the promise.
 70 		 * A promise can be resolved only once.
 71 		 * @param the resolution value
 72 		 * @returns true if the resolution function was called
 73 		 */
 74 		this.resolve = function resolve(val) {
 75 			return _stateMachine.event("resolve", val);
 76 		};
 77 		
 78 		/**
 79 		 * Reject the promise.
 80 		 * A promise can be rejected only once.
 81 		 * @param the rejection value
 82 		 * @returns true if the rejection function was called
 83 		 */
 84 		this.reject = function reject(err) {
 85 			return _stateMachine.event("reject", err);
 86 		};
 87 		
 88         /**
 89          * The callbacks and errbacks to call after resolution or rejection
 90          * @param {Function} the first parameter is a success function, it can be followed by a scope in which to run it
 91          * @param {Function} the second, or third parameter is an errback, it can also be followed by a scope
 92          * @examples:
 93          * 
 94          * then(callback)
 95          * then(callback, scope, errback, scope)
 96          * then(callback, errback)
 97          * then(callback, errback, scope)
 98          * 
 99          */     
100 		this.then = function then() {
101 	       if (arguments[0] instanceof Function) {
102                if (arguments[1] instanceof Function) {
103             	   _stateMachine.event("addSuccess", arguments[0]);
104                } else {
105             	   _stateMachine.event("addSuccess", arguments[0], arguments[1]);
106                }
107            }
108            
109            if (arguments[1] instanceof Function) {
110         	   _stateMachine.event("addFail", arguments[1], arguments[2]);
111            } 
112            
113            if (arguments[2] instanceof Function) {
114         	   _stateMachine.event("addFail", arguments[2], arguments[3]);
115            }
116            return this;
117 		};
118 		
119 		/**
120 		 * Get the promise's observable
121 		 * for debugging only
122 		 * @private
123 		 * @returns {Observable}
124 		 */
125 		this.getObservable = function getObservable() {
126 			return _observable;
127 		};
128 		
129 		/**
130 		 * Get the promise's stateMachine
131 		 * for debugging only
132 		 * @private
133 		 * @returns {StateMachine}
134 		 */
135 		this.getStateMachine = function getStateMachine() {
136 			return _stateMachine;
137 		};
138 		
139 	};
140 	
141 });
